thread.title: Bucs, Hillsborough near deal on $100M Ray Jay renovation

title: Bucs, Hillsborough near deal on $100M Ray Jay renovation
text:

Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Bucs, Hillsborough near deal on $100M Ray Jay renovation 10 News Staff, WTSP 10:29 p.m. EDT September 30, 2015 Upgrades would include high-definition scoreboards, surround sound system and other items. (Photo: Tampa Bay Times) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
The Tampa Bay Buccaneers would pay $75 million of a $100 million renovation of Raymond James Stadium in a deal with Hillsborough County and the Tampa Sports Authority, according to The Tampa Bay Times . 
The work is expected to be done in time for the college championship game in 2017, and would hopefully attract a fifth Super Bowl to Tampa. 
Upgrades for Ray Jay would include high-definition scoreboards, surround sound system, video board control room and other items would be part of the deal among the Bucs, county and Tampa Sports Authority. 
A hangup in the talks is that the team wants to play a preseason game and maybe two regular season games outside of Ray Jay -- at an international site or elsewhere in Florida -- beginning in 2018. 
The outside games would be in exchange for the Buccaneers forgiving the $11.6 million obligation the sports authority has to construct a practice facility. The Bucs see this as insurance, for their $75 million. 
Under the current lease agreement, which will continue to run through 2028, the 
The Bucs have the ability to play one home game, either regular or preseason, outside of RJS as part of the current lease agreement that runs through 2028. 
The TSA has countered with a stipulation that the Bucs cannot move a second regular season game to the same city as either of the other two games allowed under current the proposal.
